title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Points Cardinaux Métiss White (Alsace)
description: An earthy, almost savory hint of soy plays amidst the lemon freshness on the nose. The light, dry palate has a soft, creamy aspect and adds a notion of pear fruit. There is some alcoholic heat on the finish.

title: Château Fontenil 2017 Barrel Sample  (Fronsac)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Ripe with generous tannins and rich fruit, this is a soft, juicy wine full of blackberry notes. The wine will develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Clos des Baies 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. The wine is rich and suffused with fine tannins. Charmingly fruity with notes of black currant and lively acidity, this will be an attractive wine in the short term.

title: Château Valandraud 2017 Virginie de Valandraud Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Perfumed and ripe, this smooth wine has apricot and pear flavors as well as a cut of citrus. It is rounded and rich, full of fruit, and will be ready to drink from the end of 2018.

title: Château du Moulin Rouge 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This is a dry, smoky wine that has as many firm tannins as ripe fruit flavors. It has a bitter edge to it, along with ample acidity, but it does need to soften and lose that tough character. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Desmirail 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. The flavor of new wood is strong in this wine. It has a tough structure and the merest hints of fruit. It should fill out once the overbearing wood has gone. Drink from 2024.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Ezio Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Dense soil aromas, leather, olive, charred beef, roasted wood and crushed asphalt make for a very dry and savory nose on this bottling. There's a tarry character to the palate that shadows the black fruit, allowing the black olive and black pepper to take the lead.

title: Eternal 2015 Eternal Gratitude Gamache Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas seem unsettled, with notes of dust, herb and cherry. The flavors are plush and ripe, delivering plenty of enjoyment.

title: Eugene Wine Cellars 2016 b2 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This full, fleshy and affordable wine gets treated to small-lot ferments in neutral oak barrels. The fruit seems young and fresh—Gamay-like, with bright and spicy berry flavors. Drink this over the next couple of years while that freshness remains in full force.

title: Familie Steffen 2016 Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Breezy and fresh, this light-footed Riesling offers a crush of pristine white grapefruit, apple and nectarine flavors. Delicately sweet in style, it's refreshing and quaffable, with a delicately mineral finish. Drink now.

title: Fattoria di Magliano 2016 Pagliatura Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with organically farmed Vermentino grapes, this offers aromas of nectarine, yellow peach and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The aromas carry over to the crisp palate alongside firm acidity.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Campo al Capriolo  (Bolgheri)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Syrah opens with aromas of blackberry, ginger and sandalwood. The medium-bodied palate has black-currant jam, cedar and vanilla alongside smooth tannins.

title: Hawkins Cellars 2015 Enigma Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Though it's a bit astringent, the medium-bodied fruit is clean and juicy, with raspberry and cherry flavors. It seems to spread out across the palate, then winds down gracefully as it flattens into a drying astringent finish.

title: Holloran 2015 Stafford Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This tasty little Pinot introduces a well-made lineup from this producer. The pretty cherry fruit might seem delicate, but it's nonetheless persuasive. There's no thinness here; it's spot-on varietal and balanced throughout.

title: Ilaria 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This wine exhibits hearty oak and ripe black cherry, cranberry and plum. Blended with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, its grapes from Coombsville primarily, it's high-strung in supportive acidity and dried herb and tobacco.

title: J. Christopher 2015 En Gedi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This three-acre site, planted to Dijon 114 Pinot, comes up with strong aromatics loaded with baking spices. Those sweet flavors continue around standard medium-ripe berry fruit. The acids finish a bit chalky, and the effect is to dry out the flavors a bit too quickly.

title: Keswick Vineyards 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Monticello)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon expresses classic aromas and flavors of blackberry leaf, cassis, bramble, black pepper and eucalyptus. There is lovely oak integration that adds notes of clove and cedar. The tannic structure soft which make the finish feel shorter and more fruit forward.

title: Keswick Vineyards 2015 Estate Reserve Heritage Red (Monticello)
description: This wine carries pronounced tones of black currant, cassis, bramble, juniper and oak spice. The tannins are full but well integrated and hold up to the weight of this wine. The finish is long and woody.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Notes of very ripe pear dominate the nose. The palate shows more freshness to aid the spicy pear fruit on the midpalate. This is dry and fresh, with a slightly lemony finish. Drink soon.

title: Lantieri NV Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Vibrant and fun, this opens with zesty aromas of tangerine zest, white wildflower, white cherry and apple. The crisp savory palate offers Gala apple, crushed herb and orange slice. Tangy acidity and a vivacious perlage provide the backdrop.

title: Leone de Castris 2014 Donna Lisa Red (Salice Salentino)
description: A blend of Negroamaro and Malvasia Nera, this is red-fruit driven on the nose, with shades of tobacco and rubber. The palate brings a bit more depth in flavors of blackberry, cranberry and leather, yet ultimately this is light in feel from racy acidity and soft, sandy tannins. A slightly bitter dusting of cocoa powder marks the close.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2016 Cuvée Balthazar Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A rather neutral nose offers glimpses of pear and lemon. The palate is also reticent but the pear fruit it shows is fresh, clean and edged with zesty lemon. This is light, dry and fresh.

title: Mar de Viñas 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit and apple aromas are ripe and nice. This wine is fruity but imprecise on the tongue, with bold orange and apple flavors that are juicy, bright and fairly potent. Drink now.

title: Maysara 2014 Jamsheed Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This biodynamic grower and producer makes distinctive wines that require a bit of a palate adjustment for some tasters. Here, there are some funky earthy aromas suggesting compost and barnyard, with flavors following. There is little of the fresh bright fruit flavors one might associate more commonly with Oregon Pinots, but plenty of complexity, length and a light touch of new French oak.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2015 Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Lovely spicy fruit stands out here and sets this apart from many of the winery's offerings. Concentrated ripe cranberry and plum flavors come with some bite to them, in a good way. The supporting acids have a citrus character, and the clean fruit continues on through a satisfying finish.

title: Metinella di Stefano Sorlini 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Aromas of truffle, crushed herb, celery and wild berry slowly take shape on this. The medium-bodied elegant palate offers red cherry and baking spice notes alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2019.

title: Mosnel 2012 EBB Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Toast, roasted nut and dried chamomile aromas lift out of the glass. The ripe palate shows mature yellow apple skin, dried apricot, bread crust and a hint of candied tangerine zest alongside lively steely bubbles.

title: Niepoort 2015 Poeirinho Baga (Bairrada)
description: The Baga grape, a specialty of the Bairrada region, is traditionally known for its tannins. Here, in the hands of Dirk Niepoort from the Douro, it reveals a rounded, smoother character. The tannins are there although in a supporting role for the black fruits. Crisp, light and juicy, it's ready to drink from 2020

title: Patton Valley 2016 PTG Red (Willamette Valley)
description: Though clearly red, the blend here includes 8% Chardonnay and 6% Pinot Gris, along with Pinot Noir and Gamay. The result is a light quaffer, with pretty cranberry and cherry fruit that brings a touch of citrus. Though lightweight overall, it's tasty and clean, the sort of simple red just made for a roast turkey.

title: Paul Blanck 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A rather closed nose hints at lemon. The palate has lemon freshness but lacks a little focus. Nonetheless this is fresh and clean, with an appetizing citrus note on the dry finish.
